column2: "Sukuna-hime."

"Ah, <%me>.
...I'm not sure how to break the silence."

"...!
Sukuna-hime!"
"Quiet Kotoshiro. Doth I needeth to bid thee again, yond I am ill and doth not wisheth to heareth noises?"

"……<%me>!
Matoi!
Were thee good now?!"
"A-ah yeah. Thank you."
"Thanketh not me! If I didn't falleth for those meddling twins's plan..."
"Sorry. I'm really sorry. And...thanketh thee. Thee cameth backeth safely."
"I too must thank you. While we thought you were gone, it was very depressing."

"No matter what we did, her mind wandered off.
It was a struggle and I had no clue on what to do. ...It's nice seeing a smile again."
"Kotoshiro, nay needeth yond extra detaileth! I'm fain they're fine, as long as they're alive."
"Though it seemeth as if be true thee've wenteth through the impossible."
"Ah, is that so? ... I guess."
"Sayeth, thee two. Doth thee feel as if be true, thee've done too much?"
"If't be true thee wanteth, thee could reside hither. Any naysayers would be exiled."
"Doth what thee seek more important than thy liveth?"
"Shall thee protect everyone, even at yond cost?"
"1. I don't know"
"2. What do you think, Matoi?"
"I don't know... No reasons, just that I've never really put to much thought into that question."
"I don't know, I guess I never really put much thought into asking myself that question."
"Or of myself, I don't have any memory of the past."
"My memories of meeting <%me> and onwards are all I can remember."
"Each of my memories, I cherish them, because they're all I have left."
"Surely, before I lost my memory, I have other important memories as well."
"However, I cannot remember them, if they're even there anymore. I might never know..."
"That's why I want to protect everyone. I want to protect everyone I cherish."
"And because I want to protect, I will protect them all."
"Even if Luther was right about our demise, I still want to protect everyone."
"I see. Thee wanteth to protect those folk, so thee shall protect those folk."
"I'm sure mine own mother and father bethought of the same thing yond time."
"Wherefore else would they breaketh taboos and risk their liveth to save me."
"I see now, thee two. I shalt speaketh nay more about this any longer."
"However, shouldst thee wanteth a lodging quiet from the rest of the ordinary, thou art welcome hither with open arms."
